title: Rory Stewart to stand down as MP after quitting Conservatives
text:
Rory Stewart will not stand at the next election and has quit as a Conservative MP | Tolga Akmen/AFP via Getty Images Rory Stewart to stand down as MP after quitting Conservatives The former Conservative leadership contender was among 21 Tory rebels stripped of the whip in September.

LONDON — Former U.K. prime ministerial hopeful Rory Stewart will not stand at the next election and has quit as a Conservative MP.

The ex-international development secretary said on Twitter it had been a “great privilege” to serve his constituents in Penrith and the Border for a decade.

Stewart fought to become leader of the Conservative Party and prime minister in June — defying expectations with an insurgent campaign.

He was among 21 Tory rebels who were stripped of the whip in September after they defied the government to vote for a law designed to block a no-deal Brexit on October 31.
description: The former Conservative leadership contender was among 21 Tory rebels stripped of the whip in September.
